title: [Large-scale] Pediatric Emergency Medicine Simulation-Based Skills Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pediatric emergency medicine theory and clinical experience
context.additional_context: Utilization of virtual environments ensuring patient safety for rare emergency scenario training.

learning_goals: Perform 6 core pediatric emergency skills (endotracheal intubation, intravenous access, etc.) with ≥90% accuracy
Post-simulation training, confidence in skill performance improves by ≥3.5 points on a 5-point Likert scale
Through virtual patient scenarios, learners achieve ≥80% proficiency in emergency decision-making per OSCE standards
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
